title: Diff eq.: No context, w/ tang. line approx. part - a

content.description: Consider the differential equation dy/dx = ey(3x2 - 6x) . Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to the differential equation that passes through (1, 0) .
content.question: Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at the point (1, 0). Use the tangent line to approximate f(1.2).

frqParts.text: Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of f at the point (1, 0). Use the tangent line to approximate f(1.2).

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Use appropriate mathematical symbols and notation (e.g., Represent a derivative using ƒ'(x), y', and dy/dx).
